name: Cultural Property
description: This course explores the relationship between cultural property and everyday life through the themes of movement, ownership and value. Case studies, current events and debates help students understand how heritage is informed by the multiple values of cultural property. This course addresses issues of cultural property and heritage in the contemporary world that are relevant to all subfields of anthropology.
prerequisites: ANT100Y1 or ANT200Y1 or ANT204H1 or ANT207H1 or ANT253H1
